snippet: Marcello Trebitsch, who admitted he had defrauded clients over seven years until his April arrest, will pay back $5.9 million to those investors.
abstract: Marcello Trebitsch, son-in-law of former State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, pleads guilty to running $6 million Ponzi scheme; agrees to pay back more than $5.9 million to victims; is set to be sentenced on Nov 2.
lead_paragraph: Marcello Trebitsch, who admitted he had defrauded clients over seven years until his April arrest, will pay back $5.9 million to those investors.

headline.main: Sheldon Silver’s Son-in-Law Pleads Guilty in Ponzi Scheme Case
